passage_text: Toss to combine. 2 Layer sliced apples in a 9 x 12-inch (or approximately the same size) baking pan. 3 Combine brown sugar, cinnamon, and oatmeal in a bowl. Cut in the butter. Sprinkle sugar mixture over apples. 4 Bake 45 minutes or until topping looks crunchy and apples are tender. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Directions. 1  1 Heat oven to 375ºF. 2  Grease bottom and sides of 8-inch square pan with shortening. 3  2 Spread apples in pan. 4  In medium bowl, stir remaining ingredients except cream until well mixed; sprinkle over apples. 5  3 Bake about 30 minutes or until topping is golden brown and apples are tender when pierced with a fork. 1 Grease bottom and sides of 8-inch square pan with shortening. 2  2 Spread apples in pan. 3  In medium bowl, stir remaining ingredients except cream until well mixed; sprinkle over apples. 4  3 Bake about 30 minutes or until topping is golden brown and apples are tender when pierced with a fork. 5  Serve warm with cream.

Preparation. 1  Preheat oven to 450°F. Butter 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. 2  Combine brown sugar and cinnamon in large bowl. 3  Add apples and toss to coat. 4  Transfer apple mixture to prepared dish. 5  Combine flour, 1 cup sugar and butter in medium bowl. 1 Combine brown sugar and cinnamon in large bowl. 2  Add apples and toss to coat. 3  Transfer apple mixture to prepared dish. 4  Combine flour, 1 cup sugar and butter in medium bowl. 5  Using pastry blender or fingertips, blend ingredients until coarse meal forms.

1/2 tsp. cinnamon. 1/2 tsp. salt. Place apples in a buttered 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Add water. Combine the flour, oatmeal, sugar, butter, cinnamon and salt, rubbing with your fingers until it forms fine crumbs. Spread the crumbs over the apples. Bake in a 375 degree oven for about 40 minutes, uncovered.

1 In a large bowl, mix together flour, white sugar, cinnamon and salt. 2  In a small bowl, beat together egg and melted butter. 3  Stir into flour mixture. 4  Spread evenly over apples. 5  Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until topping is golden and crisp. 1 In a 9 inch square baking pan, mix sliced apples with brown sugar. 2  In a large bowl, mix together flour, white sugar, cinnamon and salt. 3  In a small bowl, beat together egg and melted butter. 4  Stir into flour mixture. 5

1 Sprinkle the crumbly mixture evenly over the apples. 2  Place in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until apples are tender when poked and the topping is golden brown and crispy. 3  Remove from the oven and serve while warm. 4  Serve with a scoop of ice cream for an extra delicious treat. 1 Place in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until apples are tender when poked and the topping is golden brown and crispy. 2  Remove from the oven and serve while warm. 3  Serve with a scoop of ice cream for an extra delicious treat.

Ready In. 1  Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 2  In a 9 inch square baking pan, mix sliced apples with brown sugar. 3  Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until topping is golden and crisp. 1 In a 9 inch square baking pan, mix sliced apples with brown sugar. 2  In a large bowl, mix together flour, white sugar, cinnamon and salt. 3  In a small bowl, beat together egg and melted butter. 4  Stir into flour mixture. 5  Spread evenly over apples.

1 The mixture should have a crumbly texture. 2  Sprinkle the crumbly mixture evenly over the apples. 3  Place in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until apples are tender when poked and the topping is golden brown and crispy. 4  Remove from the oven and serve while warm. 1 Place in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until apples are tender when poked and the topping is golden brown and crispy. 2  Remove from the oven and serve while warm. 3  Serve with a scoop of ice cream for an extra delicious treat.

1 Bake crisp 20 minutes. 2  Reduce oven temperature to 350°F. 3  Bake crisp until apples are tender and topping is golden brown, about 30 minutes. 4  Let stand 15 minutes before serving. 1 Combine brown sugar and cinnamon in large bowl. 2  Add apples and toss to coat. 3  Transfer apple mixture to prepared dish. 4  Combine flour, 1 cup sugar and butter in medium bowl. 5  Using pastry blender or fingertips, blend ingredients until coarse meal forms.
